12.47.text:
JASON SILVA: Now I'm
fascinated by airplanes.

24.71.text:
feels when one bears witness
to the power of a jet engine,

28.43.text:
to the power of
a flying machine.

31.01.text:
And I remember the first I
saw the A380 this hit me home.

33.90.text:
But Alain de Botton
says nothing prepares

36.24.text:
you or the sense of
agility and self-possession

41.16.text:
No structure of compare
the size-- a building

43.79.text:
or a cathedral-- can compare
to that feeling of freedom,

50.83.text:
He talks about walking through
a corridor that will lead you

53.67.text:
onto a craft that will
take you somewhere

55.76.text: where no one knows your name.

57.52.text:
It becomes a kind of
ontological journey.

59.86.text:
It becomes a journey
of self-realization,

64.51.text:
The jet airplane
literalizes the human goal

74.57.text:
People talk about how the
enchantment of flying,

77.00.text: the magic of flying, has faded.

83.84.text:
They're afraid to bear
witness to what is possible.

86.15.text:
Look at the appeal of those
screens in the airports

89.65.text:
with the promise of destinations
of spaces of happiness,

92.83.text:
places where the
answers might lie.

94.99.text:
Alain de Botton
beautifully talks about it.

97.47.text:
Thing of the imaginative
allure or Paris,

100.68.text:
of Amsterdam, of the Czech
Republic, of Cape Town.

104.36.text: On my god these places sing.

109.30.text:
This is the power of these
transcendent machines.

112.13.text:
And we need to just open
our eyes a little bit.

115.89.text:
This is a daily reminder
every day of what's possible.

120.63.text:
These are our technological
skins, our scaffoldings.

125.96.text:
We may be flawed
stumbling primates.

128.54.text:
But when we work together we
are primates that can fly.

138.09.text:
Hey guys, you want to take
a look at Shots of Awe

140.13.text:
behind the scenes, how
it all comes to life?

142.69.text:
Well then check
out this episode I

144.34.text:
shot on Seeker Stories, which
explores my daily rituals

148.22.text: and how we make Shots of Awe.
